dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, you mean about the FCB and FICO? Yeah, I just skimmed it. They're, like, totally severing ties, right?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, the local Data Protection Agency rejected the contract, Host_B. Said it just didn't satisfy GDPR standards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the local Data Protection Agency rejected the contract, Host_B. Said it just didn't satisfy G D P R standards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: GDPR, of course. So, this isn't just a simple business breakup, it's a regulatory issue too. What does the FCB say about it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: G D P R, of course. So, this isn't just a simple business breakup, it's a regulatory issue too. What does the F C B say about it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ruslan Omarov from FCB actually said they're phasing out their proprietary expertise, which, you know, sounds a bit concerning. He implies they're turning away from best practices.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ruslan Omarov from F C B actually said they're phasing out their proprietary expertise, which, you know, sounds a bit concerning. He implies they're turning away from best practices.

dialogue_turns.text: Turning away? That just sounds like, um, a step backward for their credit organizations, doesn't it? Quality of decision-making decreasing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Turning away? That just sounds like, um, a step backward for their credit organizations, doesn't it? Quality of decision-making decreasing?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By using the bureau's solutions in conjunction with our own cards, the quality of decision-making and the efficiency of credit organizations have increased several times over.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Absolutely! And it gets worse. FICO officially revoked FCB's provider status way back in 2014, and they no longer have a license to sell FICO Scores, even in places like Kazakhstan or Kyrgyzstan.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: FCB has been an official FICO provider since 2014 and has a license to distribute and sell FICO Scores, including in countries such as Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Moldova, as well as a number of Central Asian countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so this isn't a new problem for FICO and FCB, it's just, like, a very public culmination? And FICO themselves, what's their take?

dialogue_turns.text: John Hadlow, a Senior Consultant at FICO, was pretty blunt. He said the FCB in Kazakhstan is "no longer considered a regional partner for us."

dialogue_turns.text: Ouch. So, they don't value FCB's experience, or, like, their data quality? That's a pretty strong statement.

dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. It makes it harder for lenders to assess risk effectively. But, you know, this kinda ties into a broader narrative around FICO, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.text: It really does. The article mentions how FICO scores, like, undermined credit access in the US over 30 years ago, creating biased assessments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. The article mentions how F I C O scores, like, undermined credit access in the U S over thirty years ago, creating biased assessments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right! And now they're saying FICO isn't considered an independent standard globally, and lenders don't even trust them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.text: So, what started as a regional story in Moldova actually points to, um, a much larger challenge for FICO and the whole credit scoring industry. It's wild.
